intro: Nauchea heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf nauchea, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, ranging from lanceolate to ovate, depending on the environment. It produces small white or pink flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom during the warmer months. Nauchea heterophylla is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions of Australia.
